answers.answer: I am sure your Dr. will follow you closly as high BP is something they are always on the look out for because it can cause a lot of problems during pregnancy.  I know the bottom number is the one they worry more about and yours is really high.  Does he have you coming in more often?  I too had problems with high BP and had to be on medicines.  I would talk with your Dr about it but don't worry to much which can cause your BP to rise and remember many many women have the same thing just to delever a healthy baby.
Oh by the way my Dr had me take a baby aspirin daily.  She said it helps to prevent Preeclampsia but you must stop taking it before the due date. She had me stop a month of my due date.
my bp was a bit high during my 3rd tri.  i was not put on medication, but i had to go in weekly for non stress tests.  follow docs orders and all should be fine.

i had hbp my entire pregnancy...i was put on aldomet ( methydopa is the genaric brand for this drug)and also on bed rest. My Dr watched my hbp very closly. I went EVERY week to his office to have it monitered. At 35 weeks I was put in the hospital, and induced at 36 weeks. I had my dd via c-section at 36 weeks due to the hbp. Just try to take it easy. Hopefully your dr takes good care of you.

I had severe preeclampsia with my first baby and mild with my next. There really nothing you can do to make it go away or to lower it. You might want to check out preeclampsia.org they have a good message board.

i had severe hbp with two of my pregnancies (hospitalized twice) but with rest and medication I was able to go to term with both of them. just remember to rest as much as possible, try to eliminate any stress you can and take your meds. also, don't know if you know this or not, but they worry more about the bottom number (99) then they do the top. My doc was ok as long as my bottom number didn't go over 100. apparently, the risk of seizure goes way up if your bottom number (can't remember the medical term) goes over 100.hang in there mama!! it'll all be ok in the end as long as you take care of yourself. I agree with Christina on the baby aspirin thing though. Don't take them unless your doc says its ok.
I just do not feel any different I actually feel really good so I would be shocked if they put me on bed rest. Is it that as soon as you have high blood pressure they send you to the hospital?

For me, i was on bedrest for 4 weeks before being put in the hossy (cause home BR didnt work). Then was in the hossy 5 weeks before Kurt was born. he was ten weeks early. i think the reason they put me in so quickly is...normal women you can check their urine for protein to see how far you can go before the baby is at risk...with me...you couldnt because even when i was not preg...i spilled ALOT of protein. The only thing they could watch with me was my q4hr BPs and my daily weight (that is so depressing, lol). What finally made them deliver Kurt was..I gained 8 pounds in 24 hours.XOXOXChristina

Not to contradict the previous post about taking baby aspirin, but if you were to do that, and the Dr didnt tell you to, and you have to deliver early (I am praying you dont) you could bleed to death. I had severe pre-e and my son was delivered at 30 weeks, was on bedrest in the hospital way before that and on bedrest at home before the hossy, my son was perfect. You are in my prayers. Ask your dr. about the aspirin before taking it, it might be a good idea, but ask first.Good Luck!!!Are you lying on your left side all the time? When in the hossy, they made me lay in left side, with no light on at all (not even tv) that might help when it peaks.XOXOXOChristina

Sorry everyone I didn't mean to sugest taking baby aspirin without a Dr order.  My second post was in addition to my first about taking medicine which included baby aspirin and I had stated to talk to the Dr. in the first post.  It does have benefits that op could talk to her Dr. about.  The first time my Dr had me take baby aspirin she didn't tell me to stop a month before due date and I did have a little problem with bleeding after deliever nothing that uterine massege didn't take care of which is very very uncomfortable.  Anyways good luck to you.
